title: Abder Ramdane
text:
Abder Ramdane (born 23 February 1974) is an Algerian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former player who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
International career.
Ramdane chose to represent the <a href="Algeria%20national%20football%20team">Algeria national team</a>, being selected for one match. However, he did not participate in the game.
Coaching career.
Ramdane was employed together with his father-in-law <a href="Ewald%20Lienen">Ewald Lienen</a> as assistant coach and U-19 coach by Greek club <a href="Panionios%20F.C.">Panionios F.C.</a>, from 2006 until 2008. He held the same position previously at German side <a href="Borussia%20M%C3%B6nchengladbach">Borussia Mönchengladbach</a>. They joined <a href="TSV%201860%20Munich">TSV 1860 Munich</a> on 13 May 2009. In June 2010, both moved to <a href="Olympiacos%20F.C.">Olympiacos</a> where they stayed only for some weeks. 
In November 2010, Lienen took over as coach of <a href="Arminia%20Bielefeld">Arminia Bielefeld</a> and Ramdane followed as assistant. Both left Bielefeld when they were relegated at the end of the season. In November 2013 he and Lienen were appointed by Romanian club <a href="ASC%20O%C8%9Belul%20Gala%C8%9Bi">Oțelul Galați</a> as assistant coach and coach respectively.
In June 2018, Ramdane was appointed assistant coach to <a href="Luka%20Elsner">Luka Elsner</a> at Belgian club <a href="Royale%20Union%20Saint-Gilloise">Royale Union Saint-Gilloise</a>. In the following year, he followed Elsner to French club <a href="Amiens%20SC">Amiens SC</a>. Ramdane left Armiens with Elsner at the end of September 2020.
Honours.
SC Freiburg
Nîmes
